comments.commentBody: In the final medal tally, the only comparison that counts is the one that shows that Australia thumped Great Britain

Well, thanks world for coming out. The athletes were spectacular and we are so proud of all of their accomplishments.

That, I must say, was the worst closing ceremony that I have watched. Apologies to all for that. Just one more opportunity for Canadians to say, "I'm sorry" as we are renowned for doing. It was surreal and I can only hope that the athletes were at least able to enjoy each others' company and feel a sense of closure to an absolutely wonderful Olympics.

I felt that the closing ceremonies, while a bit hokey, were overall very entertaining. The Sochi introduction was beautiful, and definately makes one curious as to what that country will bring to the world stage. As far as the Canadian presentation goes, it was full of humour and light-heartedness. What better way to say farewell to the world and the athletes who have provided such competition and excitement for Canadians. I loved the Michael Buble performance, accompanied by what I fondly refer to as the "grotesque display of Canadiana that has been vomited on that Arena". That number was fun, humorous and captures all of our sterotypes, which Canadians know of, and most often embrace.

I think that most people who are born and raised in a country with a sense of patriotism never let that go, no matter where they live. It was nice to see the actors pay tribute to our country.

The other performers of the evening were hit and miss for me. There are so many talented and credible musicians in Canada, but the decision seem to have been that sales and worldwide recognition were more important. Which is unfortunate.

Overall, i really liked the atmosphere of the closing ceremonies, and am so proud to be Canadian, everyday.

Martin's #10 link goes off on a eclectic journey.

So what are the possible crossword responses to the clue: Detective (?)

Apparently either "shamus" or "Seamus" will do the trick. Dick isn't often seen in polite circles; is that a reference to Dick Tracy? But what is the derivation of "Tec" (41x) ?

And which of these mean (a) police detective, (b) private eye, or (c) store detective?

Can someone expound upon this, please. Thanks.

BTW - (I looked it up!) "Less" is (somewhat typically) used when the item is not countable (an amount of salt), while "fewer" is used when the items are countable.

-- jpgaskell

It should be pointed out that Buble performed an extremely ret-conned version of The Maple Leaf Forever.  All the fun stuff about conquering the French and "the thistle, shamrock, rose entwined" were dropped in favour of the new feel-good lyrics about peace and loveliness.  Totally works for this camp Broadway sendoff of kitsch Canadiana, kind of an America the Beautiful makeover on an old British Empire tune.

Some Americans posting here simply don't understand the Olympics, hardly surprising as so many Americans see things only in black and white, winning and losing, and nothing in between.  Perhaps this is why the US will decline faster than most Empires with massive residual wealth.  It is heartening to see so many Americans posting here who do understand the Olympics: striving rather than merely winning, and good sportsmanship.  The rest of you - and some of you have made vile and ignorant comments - merely validate the image of the ugly American: poor losers, and poor winners.  How sad for the rest of us to be associated with you merely by accident of birth or residence.  You damage this nation, even when all that's at stake is a bit of pride and metal.

I always thought that the biggest winner in the olympics is the country with more gold medal... Am I wrong? How cares about silver or bronze, if you are not gold, you are not the best in the world!!! The country with more gold medals has the best athlets in the competition. Just like football season, you win first place title or nothing...
Congrats Canada for being the biggest winner of this Olympics!!!

NBC may be doing a not-so-great job of covering, but I can tell you that CTV (Canadian channel) played equally as many ads. We are sick of the commercialisation of these events (sure it takes money, but how about if Pepsi and Coke (for a poor example) could pay to peddle their juices, sugar waters and ... tap water enriched with plastic particles.

And, by the way, we as a nation apologise for that production. Quite the embarassment. We blame it on the US because they've taken all our best comedy writers and paid 'em real money to do fantastic work. We had to hire an Aussie, apparently.

If I was Jerry Seinfeld I would be really mad. With the decision to cut away, NBC made millions of enemies for his new show. I just think NBC does not really understand how important Live coverage is  to most people. As a guy if it s not Live, I will not watch it. I get up at 3 AM in the morning to watch the Australian tennis Grand Slam because I have to watch it Live. ESPN, who owns the right to World Cup soccer matches shows them at whatever time they are on.  NBC can thank their lucky stars that most women who made up the bulk of NBC's audience don't seem to mind if the games are Live or not. May FOX or ESPN outbid NBC in all future Olympics after London which we will have to endure again on NBC. May Bob Costas by then be gone into a much needed retirement.

This is the comment that was sent when the U.S. beat

Canada in their first game.

On the Canadian side are winners and players that know

the if's of tense moments of winner takes all games.

The Americans haven't and because they haven't they

want.

There is such a thing as too much talent -aka- too many

cooks spoil the broth.

Good game. It was far closer than the score indicates

but they haven't been playing together for long.

They'll get better.

As in baseball's 'it ain't over 'til its over' the

Canadian take on hockey is that the series isn't over

until the final buzzer signals the winning goal has

been scored.

Until then your guess is as good as mine as to who will

win. We'll see when it happens. That's what makes

hockey so much fun.

Thanks for a good game and we'll see you in four years.

Why we won? Could've been the full moon. Canadians are proud of their athletes.

Depressed that these fine games are over. Fantastic performance, Canada.

Several requests for Jacques Rogge for Sochi 2014:

(1) Either award the tv contract to ESPN or demand that NBC allow live streaming of CTV, BBC, and EuroSport to the US for all events. NBC would only lose the diehard fans like me, who find live feeds on clandestine internet sites anyways.

(2) End the unsafe practice of limiting practice time on the luge/skeleton/bobsled track for the visiting teams. ALL teams should get 30+ practice runs on the track. Homefield advantage should be limited to cheers.

(3) Hold all ski and snowboard events at an elevation that ensures decent and safe snow conditions. Holding the freestyle and snowboard events at Whistler instead of Cypress would have ensured decent conditions.

(4) Make Apolo Ohno shave that stupid beard strip thing.
Thanks for the info. The figure came from the Dynamo media guide, perhaps it was a record at that time. I'll check further.

Set a state record for goals scored in a high school is definitely not accurate in this article. The state record in Arizona for goals scored in a high school career belonged to Vince Bianchi who scored over 120 goals during his high school career. The record was broken several years ago by Fernando Gauna. Bianchi and Gauna both played at Salpointe Catholic in Tucson, Arizona. The record was broken once again by Kyle Ciliento of Pinnacle High School who notched over 140 goals during his career.

jpg,

Both "dick" and "tec" are shortenings/corruptions of the word "detective." "Tec" seems to be used mostly for private detective, but "dick" is more broadly applicable to any detective. Or at lease, it was.
Closing ceremonies: greatest SCTV sketch EVER.

I sure hope that Apollo retires, because I would rather pluck my eyes out and gouge out my ear drums rather than see or hear more about him. The amount of time spent on Jacobellis, White, Evan L, Lindsey Vonn, and Apollo was probably 10 times more than all other athletes combined. It wasn't as if they needed to keep promoting the only known names to the point of tedium.
It's also a good thing for Costas that Jim McKay is deceased, because he would be so ashamed of how sad olympic coverage has become.
ABC did so well with just one network for years.
Maybe Costas was too wrapped up in the beginning of spring training.

Team USA competed fiercely, and its players believed in themselves - even when virtually nobody regarded them as medal contenders.  They were sorely disappointed in the loss, and the fact that they wore that disappointment on their faces during the post-game ceremonies should not be equated with poor sportsmanship.  In all seriousness - does anyone think the Canadian players would have worn different expressions had they lost today's game?  It was an altogether impressive performance by a young, relatively nameless and inexperienced American team.  The highly touted Canadians were heavily favored, yet were pressed to their limits by this brash, hard-charging American team, which overcame a two-goal deficit on the biggest stage hockey has seen in years - if ever.  Those responsible for selecting Team USA's roster deserve kudos, and while nothing will console the players, they should be very, very proud of their performance.  They left everything on the ice.  The future for USA hockey is bright indeed.  I hope and pray that Bettman allows NHL players to continue to compete in the Olympics, so that we can see these American players compete again in 4 years.

Please consider this Olympian. Mr. Seung Hoon Lee of Korea. He won Silver at 5000m  ang Gold at 10,000m both at long track speed skating. Before this Olympic win, nobody expected him to become a contender, much less a champion. Mr. Lee took up long track speed skating only in July last year when he failed to make the Korean short tract Olympic team. He participated in Asian competieion only three times. He has never competed in any world competition. You talk about underdog winning an upset victory? Here is a 20 year old young man who has achieved the impossible here in Vancouver. Watch out this athelete for next  Olympic in Sochi.

I love the Winter Games for its proud display of sports which do not receive Big Money and are driven by the gutsy performances of entrepreneurial athletes. You know that the normally once-a-lifetime games is their stage. Professional hockey notwithstanding, the amateur athletes will never enjoy such a broad public, and it brings great raw beauty to sport.

In this vein, I proudly point to the USA1 bobsled, the Night Train, who have trained for years here and overseas and have won the first USA gold in over 60 years. Mostly training and making their living on their own, Holcomb, Tomasewicz, Mesler, and Olsen set records on a track whose danger struck such fear into competitors that they dropped out rather than compete.

Their story is my favorite, but there are many other incredibly devoted athletes who are well-deserving of their nations' respect. May they continue their impressive results when the public eye shifts away!
Go ESPN!

The NBC commentators seem pretty dismissive of the Sochi presentation ("Science and whatnot", "oh, virtual horses")... it looks darned good to me! Certainly more impressive than the Canadian presentation and (obviously) better than the London embarassment at the Beijing closing ceremony.

And now NBC has stopped showing the Russian presentation to show commercials and some minidocumentary about an American athlete. Oh lawd... show some respect!

Captain's Quarters Resort, Lauderdale By The Sea has the best beach in South Florida, clean, wide and beautiful, this is the place to relax and enjoy a safe, comfortable vacation. resort rooms have kitchens or the area is populated with great restaurants. cruise into South Beach and Miami but save as much as you spend shopping by staying here. That's the discount, better beach, save money for shopping.
Team USA --Texas is proud of you!!!!

Joe #121 said "If they love Canada so much why do the play hockey in the US...could it be the money. A total bunch of frauds acting like champions."

The Pittsburgh Penguins are owned by a Canadian and a former hockey Olympian and NHLer, Mario Lemieux, who saved the franchise from bankruptcy. Guess which Olympian was drafted by Pittsburgh and continues to play for them: Sidney Crosby.

In response to rml #194:

More accurately, Canada owned the top third of the podium, while the USA owned the lower two-thirds of the podium. Is everyone happy now?

The NBC commentators seem pretty dismissive of the Sochi presentation ("Science and whatnot", "oh, virtual horses")... it looks darned good to me! Certainly more impressive than the Canadian presentation and (obviously) better than the London embarassment at the Beijing closing ceremony.

And now NBC has stopped showing the Russian presentation to show commercials and some minidocumentary about an American athlete. Oh lawd... show some respect!
That comedy routine was surprisingly unembarassing. MJF isnt doing too bad either. Good job with that 360 projection.
